001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
004
005/**
006 * A function with trainable parameters that can be estimated and updated.
007 * <p>
008 * Extends {@link EstimationFunction} by adding accessors and mutators for
009 * parameters (biases, weights, coefficients, etc.) used during training.
010 * Provides default convenience methods for reading, writing, and updating
011 * parameters.
012 */
013public interface TrainableFunction<N extends Number> extends EstimationFunction<N> {
014
015    /**
016     * Returns the number of trainable parameters of this function.
017     *
018     * @return the number of parameters
019     */
020    default int getParameterCount() {
021        return getParameters().length;
022    }
023
024    /**
025     * Returns the underlying parameter vector for this function.
026     *
027     * @return the array of parameters
028     */
029    N[] getParameters();
030
031    /**
032     * Replaces the parameter vector with the given values.
033     *
034     * @param values the new parameter values
035     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the array length does not match
036     *                                  {@link #getParameterCount()}
037     */
038    default void setParameters(N[] values) {
039        N[] parameters = getParameters();
040        if (values.length != parameters.length) {
041            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
042        }
043        System.arraycopy(values, 0, parameters, 0, parameters.length);
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Returns the parameter at the given index.
048     *
049     * @param p index of the parameter
050     * @return the parameter value
051     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
052     */
053    default N getParameter(int p) {
054        return getParameters()[p];
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Sets the parameter at the given index to the specified value.
059     *
060     * @param p     index of the parameter
061     * @param value new value to set
062     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
063     */
064    default void setParameter(int p, N value) {
065        getParameters()[p] = value;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Adjusts all parameters (except the first one, typically the bias)
070     * by adding the corresponding deltas.
071     *
072     * @param deltas an array of additive updates, aligned with the parameter vector
073     */
074    default void adjustParameters(N[] deltas) {
075        for (int p = 0; p < deltas.length; p++) {
076            adjustParameter(p, deltas[p]);
077        }
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Adjusts a single parameter by adding the given delta to its current value.
082     *
083     * @param p     index of the parameter
084     * @param delta the increment to add to the parameter value
085     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
086     */
087    default void adjustParameter(int p, N delta) {
088        setParameter(p, getCurrentNumberType().add(getParameter(p), delta));
089    }
090}
